queries.original_query: What is the FY2019 cash conversion cycle (CCC) for General Mills? CCC is defined as: DIO + DSO - DPO. DIO is defined as: 365 * (average inventory between FY2018 and FY2019) / (FY2019 COGS). DSO is defined as: 365 * (average accounts receivable between FY2018 and FY2019) / (FY2019 Revenue). DPO is defined as: 365 * (average accounts payable between FY2018 and FY2019) / (FY2019 COGS + change in inventory between FY2018 and FY2019). Round your answer to two decimal places. Address the question by using the line items and information shown within the income statement and the balance sheet.
queries.expanded_query: What is the cash conversion cycle (CCC) for General Mills for the fiscal year 2019, calculated in accordance with the formula CCC = Days Inventory Outstanding (DIO) + Days Sales Outstanding (DSO) - Days Payable Outstanding (DPO)? For this calculation, please define DIO as 365 multiplied by the average inventory balance for the fiscal years 2018 and 2019 divided by the cost of goods sold (COGS) for fiscal year 2019. Additionally, define DSO as 365 multiplied by the average accounts receivable balance for fiscal years 2018 and 2019 divided by total revenue for fiscal year 2019. Furthermore, define DPO as 365 multiplied by the average accounts payable balance for fiscal years 2018 and 2019 divided by the sum of COGS for fiscal year 2019 and the change in inventory between fiscal years 2018 and 2019. Please provide the answer rounded to two decimal places, utilizing the relevant line items and information presented in the income statement and balance sheet.

Define working capital ratio as total current assets divided by total current liabilities. Round your answer to two decimal places.
